intro: Oenanthe biebersteinii var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. It has a short, stout stem and produces small, oval fruits that contain a single seed. The species is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
